cyclone.name: IAN
cyclone.current_location: about 430 mi ESE of Kingston, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to move west tonight, then turn northwest and north-northwest across the central Caribbean, passing south of Jamaica, near/through the Cayman Islands, over western Cuba, and then into the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward the west coast of Florida
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: western Cuba (first significant land interaction before approaching Florida)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch for the Cayman Islands; Tropical Storm Watch for Jamaica (no watches yet for Florida)
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued yet for Florida coastline
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central Caribbean Islands, Cayman Islands, western Cuba, and the Florida peninsula Gulf coast (including Tampa Bay) within next 5 days
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds possible by mid-week (34-kt probability up to 51%, 50-kt up to 22%)
weather_observation.storm_surge: Increasing risk of 3 ft or greater surge along Tampa Bay if the system moves north over the eastern Gulf of Mexico
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for heavy rainfall 4–8 inches with localized higher amounts, leading to urban and flash flooding around Tampa Bay
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous marine swells and rip currents likely ahead of system’s arrival
